Root Type: Dense and shallow, up to 50 cm deep
Stem / Growth Form: Vigorous annual or short-lived perennial, trailing/creeping/twining, several meters long, forms dense tangled mass 30-50 cm deep; stems succulent, hairy
Leaf Traits: Alternate, stipulate, trifoliate with broadly elliptical, pubescent leaflets; lateral leaflets asymmetric
Reproductive Traits: Blooms and fruits seasonally (e.g., Aug-Dec in India); propagated by seed; pods containing seeds
Stress Tolerance: Tolerant of stagnant water; prefers humid tropics, clay soils pH 4.5-5, high Al; not salinity tolerant; rainfall >1250 mm, temp 18-36°C; short dry periods ok but not drought tolerant
Special Adaptations: Nitrogen-fixing; aggressive growth with allelopathy; used as cover crop/green manure; can become weed in humid tropics

Root Type: Shallow, up to 30 cm, with Rhizobium nodules
Stem / Growth Form: Perennial herb, stems grow/branch rapidly, dense mass; non-woody until 18 months; height up to 45 cm
Leaf Traits: Trifoliate, elliptical leaflets 4x3.5 cm; dark-green glabrous above, whitish tomentose below
Reproductive Traits: Pale violet flowers in racemes; pods 7.5-15 cm with up to 20 spherical 4 mm dark brown seeds; short-day; seed propagation with scarification
Stress Tolerance: Highly drought tolerant (deep roots); endures waterlogging/flooding/shade; adaptable to poor/nutrient-rich soils, acid/high Al ok; not cold tolerant
Special Adaptations: Nitrogen fixation up to 46 kg/ha; weed suppression via dense cover; adaptable to sandy-clay soils pH 4.9-5.5, high Mn; yields 80% under shade

Stem / Growth Form: Creeping, rapid growth; height 30-50 cm off ground
Leaf Traits: Green foliage with leguminous nodules producing fixed N
Reproductive Traits: Seeds 90-190 mg, black, durable but insect-susceptible pre-germination
Stress Tolerance: Temp 20-35°C (avg 28°C); high humidity/consistent rainfall; resists most insects/cattle via phenolic acids
Special Adaptations: Nitrogen regulation/fixation; cover crop in plantations (rubber/oil palm/citrus/coconut); shields soil, prevents erosion, enhances aeration/water retention; growth 10-15 cm/day

Stem / Growth Form: Perennial twining herb, stems up to 30 cm/day, elongate to 20 m; forms tangled mats >0.5 m deep
Leaf Traits: Large trifoliate; leaflets oval/triangular, 2x2 to 20x15 cm
Reproductive Traits: Vegetative (vines root at soil) or generative (epigeal germination); mauve-purple flowers in racemes; pods 4-11 cm hairy with 10-20 squarish 3x2 mm black/brown seeds
Stress Tolerance: Short dry periods ok but not drought tolerant; pH 4.3-8, acid ok; reduced shade tolerance; temp 22.1-27.4°C, colder reduces growth
Special Adaptations: Deep roots improve soil structure/prevent erosion; high N accumulation via symbiotic fixation, responsive to P; can become invasive due to fast growth/seed distribution

Stem / Growth Form: Annual grass, erect up to 1m, tillering culms
Leaf Traits: Linear, flat to folded, 15-50cm long, 3-10mm wide, glabrous
Reproductive Traits: Spike-like racemes in panicles; self-pollinating; small caryopses
Special Adaptations: C4 photosynthesis; weedy growth; iron-efficient; gluten-free grain

Stem / Growth Form: Annual bunch grass, erect up to 1m, slender culms
Leaf Traits: Linear-lanceolate, 10-30cm long, 2-5mm wide, glabrous or hairy
Special Adaptations: Rapid maturation (60-90 days); tillering for yield; low glycemic index

Stem / Growth Form: Annual monoecious grass, tall up to 4m, solid culms
Leaf Traits: Broad linear, alternate, 50-100cm long, 5-10cm wide, sword-shaped
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious tassel (male) and ear (female); wind-pollinated; kernels on cob
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; heat-tolerant; frost-sensitive; wide pH; high input needs
Special Adaptations: C4 photosynthesis; hybrid vigor; versatile uses (grain, silage); deep roots in varieties

Stem / Growth Form: Annual tall grass, erect up to 3m, robust culms
Leaf Traits: Linear, flat to folded, 30-100cm long, 1-4cm wide, waxy bloom
Reproductive Traits: Cylindrical spike with bristles; self-pollinating; small caryopses
Stress Tolerance: Extreme drought-tolerant; heat-tolerant (up to 45°C); saline/alkaline soils; low fertility
Special Adaptations: C4 pathway; CAM-like in stress; pearl-like grains; fodder dual-purpose

Stem / Growth Form: Annual grass, erect up to 1.5m, branched culms
Reproductive Traits: Dense cylindrical panicles; self-pollinating; small seeds
Special Adaptations: Fast-growing (60-100 days); bird-resistant; high lysine content; multi-harvest

Stem / Growth Form: Annual semi-aquatic grass, erect up to 1.75m, hollow culms
Reproductive Traits: Panicle with spikelets; self-pollinating; short-day varieties; caryopses
Stress Tolerance: Flood-tolerant (aerenchyma); moderate drought (upland); 20-35°C; acidic to neutral soils
Special Adaptations: C3 photosynthesis; tillering; photoperiod sensitivity; indica/japonica types

Stem / Growth Form: Annual tall grass, erect up to 4m, solid culms
Leaf Traits: Linear, 30-120cm long, 2-5cm wide, waxy, rolled in dry conditions
Reproductive Traits: Panicle compact/diffuse; self-pollinating; grains in glumes
Stress Tolerance: Drought-tolerant; heat-tolerant (up to 40°C); saline-tolerant; low fertility
Special Adaptations: C4 photosynthesis; stay-green trait; cyanogenic glucosides defense; biofuel potential

Stem / Growth Form: Annual grass, erect up to 1.5m, hollow culms
Stress Tolerance: Cold-tolerant; moderate drought; fertile loamy soils; 10-30°C
Special Adaptations: Hulled emmer wheat; high protein/gluten; rust-resistant; ancient diploid tetraploid hybrid

Leaf Traits: Opposite, 4–8 cm long, 3–5 cm wide, aromatic with essential oils
Reproductive Traits: Purple/white flowers in spikes; short-day; hydrophilic seeds
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; well-drained soils; zones 9-12; frost-sensitive
Special Adaptations: Mucilaginous seed coating for water retention; insect-repellent oils

Reproductive Traits: Long panicles up to 90cm; self-pollinating; small seeds
Stress Tolerance: Drought-tolerant; full sun; altitudes up to 3100m; pH 6-7
Special Adaptations: C4 photosynthesis; short-day; high altitude adaptation

Leaf Traits: Simple, alternate, rhombic-ovate to lanceolate, 4–12 cm long, 2–7 cm wide
Reproductive Traits: Dense catkin inflorescences; purplish-red/yellow-green flowers; dry fruits with seeds
Special Adaptations: Susceptible to aphids; adaptable to temperate regions

Stem / Growth Form: Annual, 1–2 m tall, woody central stem
Reproductive Traits: Panicles with small flowers; mostly self-fertilizing; 2mm seeds
Stress Tolerance: Saline/nutrient-poor soils; drought; -4°C to 35°C; high elevations to 4000m
Special Adaptations: Bitter saponins deter herbivores; betalains for pollination; osmotic adjustment for salinity

Stem / Growth Form: Clump-forming perennial grass, erect up to 2.5m

Reproductive Traits: Flowers white in groups; woody fruit with seeds

Stem / Growth Form: Clump-forming perennial grass, erect up to 3m
Stress Tolerance: Prefers warm, humid; sensitive to water stress
Special Adaptations: Essential oil for culinary and medicinal use

Stem / Growth Form: Tufted perennial grass, erect culms up to 3m
Special Adaptations: Palmarosa oil with rose scent, antifungal, repellent

Stem / Growth Form: Small evergreen tree, 4-9m, upright to sprawling
Special Adaptations: Fragrant heartwood oil; parasitic on hosts

Reproductive Traits: Vegetative offsets, often sterile; flowers brownish-purple
Stress Tolerance: Drought, flooding, salinity, wide pH, frost, fire
Special Adaptations: Soil binding for erosion control; termite repellent

Stem / Growth Form: Fast-growing tree up to 12m, drooping branches
Stress Tolerance: Prefers acidic soils, full sun; sensitive to cold
Special Adaptations: Highly fragrant ylang-ylang oil for perfume

Reproductive Traits: Produces many seeds in heart-shaped fruit; flowers solitary or in clusters
Special Adaptations: Fruit pulp stores nutrients; chemical defenses against pests

Reproductive Traits: Produces small seeds in capsules; dioecious
Special Adaptations: Adapts to understory conditions; latex production for defense

Reproductive Traits: Produces small seeds in berries; dioecious
Special Adaptations: Fruit protects seeds from desiccation; high biodiversity adaptation

Reproductive Traits: Produces berries with multiple seeds; flowers in cymes
Special Adaptations: Thorns deter herbivores; edible fruit attracts dispersers

Reproductive Traits: Produces many seeds in large pomelo fruit; hermaphroditic flowers
Special Adaptations: Thick rind protects fruit; high vitamin C content for nutrition

Reproductive Traits: Produces seeds in fruit; hermaphroditic, self-fertile

Reproductive Traits: Produces seeds in citron fruit; hermaphroditic
Special Adaptations: Thick rind for long storage; used in traditional medicine

Reproductive Traits: Produces small seeds in plum-like fruit; dioecious
Special Adaptations: Thorns provide defense; rapid growth for erosion control

Reproductive Traits: Produces seeds in egg-shaped fruit; hermaphroditic
Special Adaptations: Fruit stores energy; latex used medicinally

Reproductive Traits: Produces many seeds in guava fruit; flowers solitary
Special Adaptations: Fruit pulp resists rot; high antioxidant content

Reproductive Traits: Produces seeds in hog plum fruit; polygamo-dioecious
Special Adaptations: Deep roots access water; acidic fruit for preservation

Stem / Growth Form: Small to medium tree, up to 30m
Reproductive Traits: Produces seeds in java plum fruit; hermaphroditic
Special Adaptations: Fruit attracts seed dispersers; bark used medicinally

Stem / Growth Form: Clump-forming perennial grass, erect up to 2.5m
Stress Tolerance: Tropical climate, moderate drought; prefers sandy soils

Leaf Traits: Narrow lance-shaped, glossy green, lemon-scented, 10-20cm long
Reproductive Traits: Flowers white in umbels; woody fruit capsules with seeds
Stress Tolerance: Drought-tolerant, frost-tolerant, wide temperature range (-5¡C to 40¡C)
Special Adaptations: Lemon-scented essential oil for repellents; fire-adapted bark

Stem / Growth Form: Clump-forming perennial grass, erect up to 3m
Reproductive Traits: Produces flowers and seeds; propagated by division
Stress Tolerance: Prefers warm, humid; sensitive to water stress and frost
Special Adaptations: Essential oil for culinary and medicinal use (lemongrass oil)

Stem / Growth Form: Tufted perennial grass, erect culms up to 3m
Reproductive Traits: Flowers after 3 months; multiple seed harvests; self-fertile
Special Adaptations: Palmarosa oil with rose scent, antifungal, insect repellent

Stem / Growth Form: Small evergreen tree, 4-9m, upright to sprawling
Leaf Traits: Thin, opposite, ovate-lanceolate, shiny green, 3-8cm long
Reproductive Traits: Flowers after 7 years; small purple flowers; fruit bird-dispersed
Special Adaptations: Fragrant heartwood oil (sandalwood); parasitic on host roots for nutrients

Leaf Traits: Long, thin, rigid, up to 300cm, narrow
Reproductive Traits: Vegetative offsets, often sterile; brownish-purple flower spikes
Stress Tolerance: Drought, flooding, salinity, wide pH (4-8), frost, fire tolerant
Special Adaptations: Soil binding for erosion control; termite repellent (vetiver oil)

Stem / Growth Form: Fast-growing tree up to 12m, drooping branches
Leaf Traits: Pinnate, glossy, oval pointed, 13-21cm long, 4-7 leaflets
Reproductive Traits: Fragrant drooping green-yellow flowers; fruit bird-dispersed
Stress Tolerance: Prefers acidic soils (pH 5.5-7), full sun; sensitive to cold (<10¡C)
Special Adaptations: Highly fragrant ylang-ylang oil for perfume; attracts pollinators

Stem / Growth Form: Annual herb, erect up to 1.75m, square stems
Leaf Traits: Opposite, ovate to triangular, 4-8cm long, 3-5cm wide, toothed, aromatic
Reproductive Traits: Purple/white flowers in whorls/spikes; short-day plant; mucilaginous seeds
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; well-drained soils; USDA zones 9-12; frost-sensitive
Special Adaptations: Mucilaginous seed coating for water retention; omega-3 rich seeds; insect-repellent oils

Stem / Growth Form: Herbaceous annual, erect up to 2.5m, branched
Leaf Traits: Broad, simple, alternate, ovate to lanceolate, 5-15cm long
Reproductive Traits: Long pendulous panicles up to 90cm; self-pollinating; thousands of small seeds per plant
Stress Tolerance: Drought-tolerant; full sun; altitudes up to 3100m; pH 6-7; heat-tolerant
Special Adaptations: C4 photosynthesis for efficient water use; short-day; high altitude adaptation; edible leaves/seeds

Stem / Growth Form: Vigorous upright annual, 40-200cm tall, sturdy stems
Leaf Traits: Simple, alternate, rhombic-ovate to lanceolate, 4-12cm long, 2-7cm wide, wavy margins
Reproductive Traits: Dense catkin-like inflorescences; purplish-red/yellow-green flowers; dry fruits with 100s of seeds
Stress Tolerance: Well-drained soils; full sun; USDA zones 3-10; moderate drought
Special Adaptations: Susceptible to aphids; adaptable to temperate regions; high protein seeds; ornamental tassels

Stem / Growth Form: Annual, 1-2m tall, woody central stem, branched
Leaf Traits: Broad, powdery (farina), hairy, lobed, alternate, triangular, 4-10cm long
Reproductive Traits: Panicles with small green/white flowers; mostly self-fertilizing; 2mm dark seeds
Stress Tolerance: Saline/nutrient-poor soils; drought; -4¡C to 35¡C; high elevations to 4000m; alkaline tolerant
Special Adaptations: Bitter saponins deter herbivores/birds; betalains for UV protection; osmotic adjustment for salinity/drought

Stem / Growth Form: Tall tree, up to 50m, cylindrical trunk with smooth gray bark
Leaf Traits: Pinnate, feather-shaped, up to 6m long, glossy green, 200-300 leaflets
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious; axillary inflorescences with male/female flowers; drupes with seeds (nuts)
Special Adaptations: Thick fibrous husk protects seeds; endosperm stores water/nutrients; copra oil for multiple uses

Stem / Growth Form: Tall deciduous tree, up to 43m, cylindrical trunk, buttresses
Leaf Traits: Spiral compound with 3 leaflets, oval-lanceolate, shiny green, 10-20cm long
Reproductive Traits: Dioecious in practice; flowers after 7 years in panicles; 3-lobed capsules with seeds
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; frost-sensitive (<10¡C); wide pH (4.5-8); humid tropics
Special Adaptations: Latex production as defense against herbivores; rapid growth (up to 2m/year); wind-dispersed seeds

Stem / Growth Form: Annual herbaceous, erect up to 1.75m, hollow jointed culms
Reproductive Traits: Spikelets in panicles; short-day; self-pollinating; caryopses (grains)
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought (upland varieties); cold-sensitive; flooded paddies; 20-35¡C
Special Adaptations: C3 photosynthesis; aerenchyma for anaerobic conditions; semi-aquatic adaptations; high tillering

Stem / Growth Form: Slender unbranched palm tree, up to 20m, ringed trunk
Leaf Traits: Pinnate, 1.5-2m long, reduplicate, numerous crowded leaflets
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious; branched inflorescences with male/female flowers; orange-red drupes
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; humid tropics (25-30¡C); 1500-2500mm rain; shade-tolerant
Special Adaptations: Fruit alkaloids (arecoline) for stimulation; rapid growth; used in cultural practices

Stem / Growth Form: Shrub-like evergreen tree, up to 9m (pruned to 2-3m), upright
Leaf Traits: Opposite, ovate, glossy dark green, waxy, 10-15cm long
Reproductive Traits: Hermaphroditic white fragrant flowers; red cherries with 2 seeds; self-fertile, cross-pollinated
Stress Tolerance: Heat-tolerant (15-24¡C optimal); moderate drought; frost-sensitive; high altitudes (600-2000m)
Special Adaptations: Caffeine as chemical defense; shade-tolerant; berries protect seeds

Stem / Growth Form: Climbing evergreen vine, up to 6m, woody at base
Leaf Traits: Heart-shaped to oval, glossy, alternate, 5-10cm long, aromatic
Reproductive Traits: Spikes of small flowers; drupes ripen to black pepper; dioecious but often hermaphroditic
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; heat-tolerant (25-30¡C); frost-sensitive; humid shade
Special Adaptations: Piperine chemical defenses; symbiotic mycorrhizae for nutrient uptake; climbing habit for support

Stem / Growth Form: Large evergreen tree, up to 30m, low broad canopy
Leaf Traits: Simple, lanceolate, leathery, aromatic, alternate, 15-35cm long
Reproductive Traits: Panicles of small flowers; drupes with single large seed; insect-pollinated
Special Adaptations: Resinous bark/latex defense; deep roots for groundwater; fruit ethylene for ripening

Stem / Growth Form: Evergreen tree, 10-20m, straight trunk, dense crown
Leaf Traits: Large simple alternate, oblong-elliptic, glossy, 5-25cm long
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious; multiple female flowers fuse into syncarp (jackfruit); wind/insect pollinated
Stress Tolerance: Drought-tolerant once established; heat-tolerant; moderate flood; 25-35¡C
Special Adaptations: Milky latex in tissues for defense; composite fruit structure; edible seeds/fruit

Stem / Growth Form: Woody shrub/herbaceous perennial, up to 4m, branched
Leaf Traits: Alternate, palmately lobed (3-7 lobes), spirally arranged, 5-20cm long
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious; flowers in panicles (male/female separate); explosive capsules with seeds
Special Adaptations: Cyanogenic glycosides deter herbivores; tubers store carbohydrates; vegetative propagation

Stem / Growth Form: Giant herbaceous perennial, pseudostem up to 9m, clumping
Leaf Traits: Large oblong, spiral, up to 3m long x 50cm wide, waxy
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious; large inflorescence with male/female flowers; parthenocarpic fruit (bananas)
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; cold-sensitive (<15¡C); prefers humid tropics; wind damage prone
Special Adaptations: Rapid vegetative propagation via suckers; aerenchyma for flood tolerance; sterile hybrids common

Stem / Growth Form: Herbaceous perennial grown as annual, erect/stemmy up to 1m
Reproductive Traits: Flowers white/purple in racemes; tubers for asexual reproduction; true seeds rare
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; frost-sensitive; cool climates (15-20¡C); various day lengths
Special Adaptations: Tubers store energy/starch; glycoalkaloids (solanine) as defense; indeterminate growth

Stem / Growth Form: Trailing herbaceous vine, up to 5m long, twining
Leaf Traits: Heart-shaped to lobed, alternate, 5-15cm long, spirally arranged
Reproductive Traits: Funnel-shaped flowers in clusters; capsules with seeds; often propagated vegetatively
Special Adaptations: Storage roots (tubers) for survival; beta-carotene rich; vine covers ground to suppress weeds

Stem / Growth Form: Clumping herbaceous perennial, up to 4m, leafy stems
Reproductive Traits: Hermaphroditic flowers on spikes from ground; capsules with seeds; cross-pollinated
Special Adaptations: Aromatic pods for spice; underground rhizomes for propagation; prefers forest understory

Stem / Growth Form: Small evergreen tree, up to 8m, single stem
Leaf Traits: Opposite, oblong-lanceolate, glossy green, 5-15cm long, aromatic
Reproductive Traits: Small yellowish flowers in panicles; berry-like drupes with single seed
Stress Tolerance: Moderate drought; tropical; sensitive to frost; well-drained soils
Special Adaptations: Bark quills for cinnamon; essential oils (cinnamaldehyde) antimicrobial; coppicing ability

Stem / Growth Form: Evergreen tree, up to 20m, pyramidal crown
Leaf Traits: Simple, alternate, oblong, dark green, leathery, 5-12cm long
Reproductive Traits: Dioecious; bell-shaped flowers; orange aril-covered seeds (nutmeg/mace)
Special Adaptations: Aril (mace) attracts birds for dispersal; toxic compounds deter herbivores

Stem / Growth Form: Large evergreen tree, up to 25m, umbrella-shaped
Leaf Traits: Pinnate compound, 10-20cm long, 10-20 pairs of leaflets
Reproductive Traits: Racemes of yellow/red flowers; pods with 1-12 seeds; insect-pollinated
Stress Tolerance: Drought-tolerant; heat-tolerant; poor soils; flood-tolerant roots
Special Adaptations: Pods with acidic pulp for long storage; nitrogen-fixing associations; multipurpose (food/fodder)

Stem / Growth Form: Small to medium evergreen tree, up to 12m, conical
Reproductive Traits: Hermaphroditic flowers in panicles; hypanthium develops into clove (flower bud)
Stress Tolerance: Tropical high rainfall; frost-sensitive; well-drained volcanic soils
Special Adaptations: Eugenol in buds/oils for preservation; attracts pollinators; wind-resistant

Stem / Growth Form: Herbaceous perennial, up to 1m, reed-like stems
Reproductive Traits: Flowers in spikes on separate shoots; seeds rare; propagated by rhizomes
Special Adaptations: Rhizomes store gingerols (medicinal); underground growth for protection; sterile cultivar

Stem / Growth Form: Herbaceous perennial, up to 1m, leafy shoots
Leaf Traits: Oblong-lanceolate, cauline, 20-50cm long, green with purple veins
Reproductive Traits: Cone-like spikes of flowers; aroids with seeds; mainly vegetative propagation
Stress Tolerance: Tropical; shade partial; drought-moderate; 20-35¡C; acidic soils
Special Adaptations: Rhizomes with curcumin (anti-inflammatory); underground storage; ornamental flowers

Stem / Growth Form: Herbaceous perennial, up to 60cm, hollow leaves
Reproductive Traits: Flowers in umbels (often replaced by bulbils); cloves for asexual reproduction
Special Adaptations: Bulbs/cloves with allicin (antimicrobial); overwinters as bulbs; pest-repellent

Stem / Growth Form: Small evergreen tree, up to 12m, low-branching
Leaf Traits: Obovate, leathery, spirally alternate, 5-12cm long, glossy
Reproductive Traits: Dioecious; panicles of flowers; pseudodrupes with seed (cashew nut)
Special Adaptations: Caustic resin in shell for defense; nut storage; coppices well

Stem / Growth Form: Herbaceous tree-like, up to 10m, single trunk
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious/dioecious; flowers solitary/clusters; pepo fruit with many seeds
Special Adaptations: Papain enzyme in latex; rapid growth (9 months to fruit); hollow stem for lightweight

Stem / Growth Form: Terrestrial bromeliad, rosette up to 1.5m, short stem
Leaf Traits: Tough, waxy, spirally arranged, sword-shaped, 30-100cm long
Reproductive Traits: Hermaphroditic flowers in head; develops into multiple fruit (pineapple); self-incompatible
Stress Tolerance: Drought-tolerant; acidic soils; heat-tolerant; CAM photosynthesis
Special Adaptations: Bromelain enzyme; spiny leaves deter herbivores; propagates via crown/suckers

Stem / Growth Form: Slender deciduous tree, up to 12m, feathery crown
Reproductive Traits: Panicles of white flowers; 3-valved pods with winged seeds; self-fertile
Special Adaptations: All parts edible/medicinal; rapid growth; pod seeds for water purification

Stem / Growth Form: Annual herbaceous, erect up to 2m, stellate hairs
Reproductive Traits: Yellow flowers with red center; capsules (pods) with many seeds
Special Adaptations: Mucilaginous pods for texture; fiber in stems; attracts pollinators

Stem / Growth Form: Herbaceous perennial grown as annual, bushy up to 1m
Leaf Traits: Simple, alternate, ovate, 5-20cm long, undulate margins
Reproductive Traits: Purple flowers in clusters; berries (eggplants) with many seeds
Special Adaptations: Solasodine alkaloids defense; nightshade family; grafted for disease resistance

Leaf Traits: Ovate to lanceolate, simple, alternate, 4-10cm long
Reproductive Traits: White flowers; berries (peppers/chillies) with many seeds; self-pollinating
Special Adaptations: Capsaicin deters mammals/birds; varied fruit shapes/colors; day-neutral

Stem / Growth Form: Annual climbing vine, up to 10m, tendrils
Reproductive Traits: White flowers monoecious; pepo fruits (gourds) with many seeds
Special Adaptations: Hard rind for storage/tools; long fruits for transport; insect-pollinated

Stem / Growth Form: Trailing annual vine, up to 10m, tendrils
Leaf Traits: Broad, triangular to heart-shaped, alternate, 10-25cm long
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious yellow flowers; pepo fruits (pumpkins/squash) with seeds
Special Adaptations: Large fruits store seeds; pollination by bees; genetic diversity for hybrids

Stem / Growth Form: Annual climbing/trailing vine, up to 3m, tendrils
Reproductive Traits: Monoecious yellow flowers; pepo fruits (cucumbers) with many seeds
Special Adaptations: Rapid growth; high water content; tendrils for support; gynoecious lines

Stem / Growth Form: Annual climbing or bushy, up to 2m, twining
Reproductive Traits: Papilionaceous flowers; pods with 10-20 seeds; self-pollinating
Special Adaptations: Symbiotic nitrogen fixation; dual purpose (pods/leaves); climbing for light

Stem / Growth Form: Biennial herbaceous, erect up to 1m, branched
Reproductive Traits: White umbel flowers; dry schizocarp fruits with seeds; insect-pollinated
Stress Tolerance: Cold-tolerant; drought-moderate; biennial lifecycle; sandy soils
Special Adaptations: Storage taproot for overwintering; umbels attract beneficial insects; anthocyanins in varieties

Stem / Growth Form: Biennial herbaceous, erect up to 1m, rosette
Leaf Traits: Simple, alternate, ovate to triangular, 10-30cm long, red-veined
Reproductive Traits: Green flowers in spikes; schizocarp with 2-4 seeds; wind-pollinated
Special Adaptations: Storage root with sugars/betalains; leaves edible; bolting resistant varieties

Leaf Traits: Large, glaucous, simple to lobed, 20-50cm wide (cabbage head)
Reproductive Traits: Yellow flowers in racemes; siliques with seeds; self-incompatible
Stress Tolerance: Cold-tolerant; moderate heat; frost-hardy; clubroot resistant varieties
Special Adaptations: Tight leaf heads for storage; glucosinolates defense; diverse forms (cabbage, broccoli)

Stem / Growth Form: Annual bush or climbing, up to 3m, twining
Reproductive Traits: White/purple flowers; pods with 4-6 seeds; self-pollinating
Special Adaptations: Protein-rich seeds; climbing for yield; day-neutral; Mesoamerican/Andean types

Stem / Growth Form: Biennial herbaceous, up to 1m, hollow stems
Reproductive Traits: Spherical umbels of flowers; bulbils or seeds; bulbing triggered by day length
Special Adaptations: Bulbs store fructans; sulfur compounds for flavor/defense; overwinters as bulbs

Stem / Growth Form: Annual herbaceous, erect or sprawling up to 2m, indeterminate
Reproductive Traits: Yellow flowers in racemes; berries with many seeds; self-pollinating
Stress Tolerance: Heat-tolerant; moderate drought; frost-sensitive; parthenocarpic types
Special Adaptations: Lycopene antioxidants; rapid fruit set; grafting for disease resistance

Leaf Traits: Elliptic to obovate, serrate, leathery, 4-10cm long, glossy
Reproductive Traits: White fragrant flowers axillary; capsules with 1-3 seeds; cross-pollinated
Stress Tolerance: Acidic soils (pH 4.5-5.5); moderate drought; frost-tolerant varieties; high rainfall
Special Adaptations: Tannins/caffeine defense; continuous leaf production; clonal propagation

Stem / Growth Form: Small evergreen tree, up to 8m, low branching
Leaf Traits: Alternate, oblong, glossy, 10-30cm long, wavy edges
Reproductive Traits: Small pink/white flowers on trunk (cauliflory); pods with 20-60 seeds; midge-pollinated
Stress Tolerance: Shade-tolerant; humid tropics; frost-sensitive; 20-30¡C; high humidity
Special Adaptations: Theobromine alkaloids; pods ripen on tree; fermentation for flavor

Stem / Growth Form: Large deciduous tree, up to 40m, buttressed trunk
Leaf Traits: Opposite, large ovate, 15-60cm long, rough hairy, deciduous
Reproductive Traits: Small white flowers in large panicles; dry capsules with winged seeds; wind-dispersed
Special Adaptations: Valuable timber; large leaves for shade; coppices; termite-resistant wood
